projects.title: Mutiny
projects.shortDescription: Rogue-lite card game mixing deck-building and strategic combat.
projects.fullDescription: Mutiny is a game in development that combines rogue-lite elements with card game mechanics. Players build their deck and face increasingly powerful enemies. Independently handled game design, art, and coding with dozens of cards and gameplay mechanics built on a modular architecture.

media.caption: Gameplay demo showing card mechanics and combat

features: Dozens of unique cards with modular mechanics

projects.title: Project: Paranoïa
projects.shortDescription: Horror game proof of concept set in a psychiatric hospital with escape room mechanics.
projects.fullDescription: Project: Paranoïa is a proof of concept for a horror game developed in Unreal Engine 5. The player takes on the role of an amnesiac patient in a psychiatric hospital and must solve escape room-inspired puzzles to uncover their past. The project emphasizes an oppressive atmosphere through graphics rendering, lighting, and sound design. Gameplay is based on exploration, puzzle-solving, and environmental storytelling.

media.caption: Gameplay demo showing escape room mechanics and oppressive atmosphere

features: Escape room style puzzles and mechanics
Oppressive atmosphere through graphics and lighting
Integrated sound design for enhanced horror experience
projects.challenges: Creating a tense and immersive horror atmosphere while designing engaging escape room mechanics using Unreal Engine 5's Blueprint system and maintaining narrative coherence through environmental storytelling.

projects.title: Custom ECS Game Engine
projects.shortDescription: A lightweight 3D ECS game engine built from scratch in C++.
projects.fullDescription: Developed a lightweight 3D ECS game engine from the ground up using C++. The engine features a modular design, supporting rendering, input handling, and scene management. It serves as a foundation for learning and experimenting with game development concepts.

media.caption: Engine rendering a sample scene with a custom shader as skybox

features: Assets compilation for optimized loading times
projects.detailedDiscussion:
Architecture Overview

The engine uses an Entity-Component-System architecture for maximum flexibility. The entire runtime context is spread into three differents abstractions :

  • World : Stores all entities and their components.
  • System : Fetch queries onto the engine World to encode behaviours.
  • Service : Single instance, kind of a manager, for global propreties (e.g. Input, Window, ...).

Here is an example of a simple scene using the engine.

projects.title: Slade
projects.shortDescription: Android arcade game testing concentration and reflexes.
projects.fullDescription: Slade is an arcade game that tests concentration and reflexes. Players must avoid projectiles and enemies to achieve the best score, unlock skins, and manage energy to slow down time. Developed with Unity (C#), it was my first game published on the Google Play Store in 2020. Due to lack of time, the project was abandoned and removed from the store.

projects.title: Light and Darkness
projects.shortDescription: 2D platformer based on light/darkness duality mechanics.
projects.fullDescription: Light and Darkness is a 2D platformer based on the duality of light and darkness. The player can reveal hidden platforms and paths by spreading light in a world plunged into darkness. The project was created in collaboration with a 2D graphic artist. I handled all gameplay and mechanics implementation.
